results.title: Epstein
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper, Alan Harper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: A record of the Memorial Exhibition held in Edinburgh in 1961 of the work of Sir Jacob Epstein. Traces the development of his work and shows many of his well-known pieces - portraits of his family, of children, of many public figures, as well as his powerful symbolic figures including Lucifer, the forerunner to his St Michael on Coventry Cathedral.

results.title: Eppalock: the first six months
results.creator_credit: Department of Agriculture and Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Soil Conservation Authority’s first six months work on the big Eppalock catchment project, in which the Authority is cooperating with government departments, landholders and local councils to apply soil conservation measures to the whole of an 800 square mile catchment to ensure that only pure silt free water reaches the Eppalock Reservoir.

results.title: Epiphany
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “The Australian eye III”.
Ian Fairweather’s ‘Epiphany’ (1962) which describes events to come in the life of the child Jesus, is considered by many of his admirers to be his greatest work. The film examines this powerful, sombre painting in detail, illuminating its intricacies and drawing on other related works by the artist, including a number of rarely seen canvasses from private collections

results.title: Epilepsy: assessment and management
results.brief_description: Video footage of a 2001 satellite broadcast to country doctors through the Rural Health satellite network and “The Health Channel” which was also streamed on the web. A panel of experts comprising epileptologists, a clinical pharmacologist and a general practitioner discuss epilepsy, a common, misunderstood, misdiagnosed and often unrecognised condition affecting between 1-2% of the population. Emphasis is placed on treating individuals on a case by case basis and the importance of tailoring treatment to the individual. Myths surrounding the disease are explored, facts and figures provided, definitions, types of seizures, diagnosis, treatment, resources and an interview with Tony Grieg, diagnosed with epilepsy age 12. Also features 2 case studies. Norman Swan hosts the panel.

results.title: Epaves
results.brief_description: Shows the underwater life that is discovered during a trip 130 feet below the surface of the sea when exploring shipwrecks near Toulon in the Mediterranean sea. Two deep-sea divers, equipped with special cameras and other equipment, record the lively activity that takes place among the fish and undersea flora and fauna as the men inspect the shipwrecks.

results.title: Environmental awareness
results.brief_description: This film is a series of finger paintings which demonstrate how the countryside and people are affected by the growth of industry and its consequential pollution. Without words, the film uses music to express mood changes, highlighting environmental situations that emphasise the immediacy of environmental problems today.

results.title: Environment in the balance
results.brief_description: Shows how geological, topographical and social developments in Britain have helped to shape its present environment and discusses the problems of industrial expansion, population growth and pollution.

results.title: Entropy: a measure of the disorganization or degradation of the universe (AIE, Module one)
results.creator_credit: Claire Spoelstra, Daniel Riddle, Jason Keen, Kai Faigenbaum, Paul Spence and Academy of Interactive Entertainment (AIE)
results.brief_description:
An exercise in exploring the concept of ‘entropy’ by a group of 5 students has resulted in 5 comic, high quality 3D animations.
The works are: Potato feelings (Daniel Riddle), Mad damn cow (Kai Faigenbaum), Letting go (Claire Spoelstra), Train of thought (Jason Keen), Allsorts (Paul Spence)
